author: Saumya Vaishampayan
title: Indonesia Raises Interest Rates Again to Stem a Slide in Its Currency
text:
Indonesiaâ€™s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate for the second time in two weeks, the latest attempt by policy makers in an emerging market to tame the effects of a stronger dollar.
Bank Indonesia on Wednesday lifted the seven-day reverse repo rate to 4.75% from the previous 4.5%, a move that had been widely expected by economists since new central bank head Perry Warjiyo set the policy meeting in recent days. It had earlier raised the rate by a quarter of a percentage point on May 17.
